subject: p18110020
Impression: AP chest compared to. Nasogastric tube has been withdrawn terminating at the gastroesophageal junction and would need to be advanced at least 10 cm to move all the side ports into the stomach. Severe thoracolumbar scoliosis distorts the shape of the chest cage which is quite small. Borderline cardiomegaly is stable. Right lung is clear. Atelectasis at the base of the left could be due partially to chest cage deformity, and there might be a small left pleural effusion. No pneumothorax.
